text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Top Bosnian officials sign an agreement with the United States Agency for International Development on Tuesday for a $35 million support programme to improve municipal infrastructure and services damaged during the war.

- All sides agree to participate in elections and to do their best to have them pass in a democratic atmosphere, deputy to the High Representative for Bosnia, Michael Steiner tells news conference in Jahorina on Tuesday.
- The Sarajevo Central Bank anounces on Tuesday it was introducing transactions by check payment for its clients for the first time since war began in 1992.
